channels.title: Kids Play
channels.description:
Welcome to KidsPlay!

KidsPlay is a place where kids can have fun and learn with our family friendly videos!

Recent.title: Annie and Sammy Play with Toys and Save It from Water Challenge.
Recent.description: Annie and Sammy were playing together when water spilled into their play area due to Annie's carelessness while brushing her Annie and Sammy were best friends who loved to spend their afternoons playing together. They would run around, chase each other and play with their favorite toys. On this particular afternoon, they were playing in their play area, which was set up in the backyard of Annie's house.Annie had just finished brushing her teeth and was rinsing her mouth with water when she accidentally spilled the water onto the ground. She quickly tried to wipe it up with a towel, but it was too late. The water had spread all over the play area, and Sammy's favorite toy was soaked. Sammy was upset and began to cry, but Annie quickly apologized and tried to make things right. She ran to get some towels to clean up the mess and helped Sammy dry off his toy. As they were cleaning up, Annie explained to Sammy that she was sorry for being careless and that she would be more careful in the future. Sammy forgave Annie and they continued to play, but something was different. The ground was wet, and they had to be careful not to slip and fall. They decided to play a game where they jumped over the wet spots, and they laughed and had fun, even though the ground was wet. As they were playing, Annie realized that accidents happen, but what's important is how you handle them. She was glad that Sammy forgave her and that they were still able to have fun together, even though she had made a mistake. After they finished playing, Annie's mom came outside and saw the wet ground. Annie told her what happened and apologized for the mess. Her mom smiled and told her that accidents happen, and it's important to learn from them. She helped them clean up the play area and reminded them to be more careful in the future. Annie and Sammy learned a valuable lesson that day. They learned that accidents happen, but it's important to take responsibility for your actions and try to make things right. They also learned that even when things don't go as planned, you can still have fun if you have the right attitude. From that day on, Annie was more careful when brushing her teeth, and they never had a spill like that again.

Recent.title: Sammy and Annie Pretend Play Taking Care of Pets
Recent.description: Wendy and Alex were siblings who loved to spend time together. Their favorite activity was playing in the pool, especially during the hot summer days. They would splash around, play games, and have fun together.One sunny afternoon, Wendy and Alex went outside to the pool, wearing their bathing suits and sunscreen. They ran to the pool and jumped in, feeling the cool water refresh their bodies from the hot sun.They started to play a game of Marco Polo, with Wendy being 'it.' Wendy closed her eyes and called out 'Marco,' while Alex and Wendy's friends swam around her, shouting 'Polo' in response.They played the game for a while, splashing around and laughing, but then Wendy noticed something strange. She saw that Alex was having trouble swimming and looked like he was struggling to stay afloat.Wendy quickly realized that her little brother was in trouble and rushed to him. She grabbed him and pulled him to the side of the pool, where he could hold onto the edge and catch his breath.Wendy's friends and other family members quickly noticed what had happened and came to check on Alex. They made sure he was okay and Wendy explained what had happened.Alex was embarrassed that he had struggled in the water, but Wendy reassured him that it was nothing to be ashamed of. She reminded him that swimming is a skill that takes time to learn, and that everyone needs to start somewhere.Wendy offered to help Alex practice his swimming, and they spent the rest of the afternoon working on his strokes and technique. By the end of the day, Alex had improved significantly and felt more confident in the water.As they got out of the pool and dried off, Wendy told Alex how proud she was of him for not giving up and for working hard to improve his swimming. Alex smiled and thanked her, feeling grateful for his sister's love and support.From that day on, Wendy and Alex continued to enjoy playing in the pool together, but they made sure to always be mindful of their safety and to never take risks in the water. They learned the importance of looking out for one another and never taking their ability to swim for granted.
